Argentina:
Juan Manuel de Rosas begins the First Conquest of the Desert
British forces re-occupy the Falkland Islands
Australia: The penal settlement of Port Arthur was founded in Van Diemen's Land.
Barbados: The Slavery Abolition Act 1833 is passed, ending the practice of slavery throughout the British Empire.
Chile: Chilean Constitution of 1833. "Portalian" — that is, inspired by Diego Portales — definitively fixed Chilean institutions.
Singapore: Kenneth Murchison was appointed as the third Governor of the Straits Settlements.
Vietnam:
Nông Văn Vân Uprising.
Lê Văn Khôi Revolt.
Emperor Minh Mạng (1820–1841) ended his rule of Vietnam.
